Text: Gas Curves Marks and UpdatesPST Meeting to organize gas curve validations with PwC
Gas Curves Marks and UpdatesPST When Thursday January AM AM GMT Central Time US Canada Where Meeting to organize gas curve validations with PwC

VaR MeetingPST All Our next meeting is September Friday The VaR presentation was this morning and is included below With this in mind now is good time to refocus on the task force objectives and deliverables listed below and come up with our action steps The dial in number is Objectives Ensure accuracy of the VaR number reported for all Enron business groups by Increasing understanding of the models processes and systems involved in computing VaR Identifying relevant input parameters used in the VaR computation and understanding how these are determined and fed into the VaR engine Developing ways to easily identify exceptions errors in the VaR computation process Clarify roles and responsibilities in the VaR computation and reporting processes Summarize and document findings by developing training materials for all concerned parties Deliverables Detailed documentation of systems processes and information flows related to the VaR computation VaR validation methodology Operational validation eg exception reporting mechanism Daily Change Analysis Report Informational or Data validation eg Being able to explain daily VaR movements Model validation Backtesting validation of parameters curves factors correlations etc List of roles and responsibilities for all concerned groups Training materials for risk team members Recommendations for future maintenance of task force activities and improvements Have a good Labor Day Keith

Updated Tomorrows StressScenario Meeting REVISED LOCATION EB Cc PST All In lieu of tomorrows standard task force meeting RAC will be demonstrating Stress VaR capabilities on certain tests scripts created by the EIMs Paper group You are invited to attend this demonstration in Naveen Andrews office EB Additionally at the suggestion of the group were proposing that the standing meeting time be changed to Wednesdays from pm vs the existing Friday pm Let me know if this fits your calendars Regards Keith

FW Option SensitivityErrol Thought you may want to look at what Stacey put together if you havent done this yet Original Message From White Stacey W Sent Friday October AM To Considine Keith Subject FW Option Sensitivity Keith Here are the procedures for the East The West is not currently running option sensitivities Approximately every one to two weeks or as requested by the options traders an option sensitivity report is run using PortCalc Three parameters are tested Price increments from to monthly Volatility increments from to and Time increments up to days Reminder the increments are changeable The data is imported from PortCalc into an Excel pivot table The pivot table is then used to show how the various Greeks delta gamma theta and Vega change for each traders book generally with a month look ahead The data can also be sorted by and grouped by other criteria if requested such as by region and delivery date These reports are given to the East option traders only Thanks Stacey

RE requested historical extract Cc The PwC Data team has the truequote file and will be working to populate the templates over the weekend Original Message From Barone Michael Sent Friday February PM To Considine Keith Subject FW requested historical extract Original Message From Kelly Katherine L Sent Friday February PM To Barone Michael Cc Bowler Tim McMichael Jr Ed Subject RE requested historical extract Actually for the most part I think we are starting to reach a point where we have inputted the majority of what we have However there are still a number of points which we do not have any information on at all like Sonat Koch and Florida Then of course many of our points do not go out that far into the future Lastly these additional quotes can make a difference in what the shape of the curves may be Thus what I guess Im trying to say is that we are reaching a point where we really need to get these additional quotes loaded or at least gain access to them so that we can continue to make progress on the curve validations On the east I am also still working with Chance to get access to Sandra Brawners revised curves so that we can either load or copy that into the sheets as well Once that is done we can proceed forward with looking at the curves to see if they make sense Please keep me posted on what you know about the Truequote progress We are at the point where we really need them Thanks Kathy Original Message From Barone Michael Sent Friday February PM To Kelly Katherine L Cc Bowler Tim Subject RE requested historical extract The electronic broker data is coming in various formats and we are in the process of trying to determine if we can automate the loading of the quote data into the templates So please continue loading the broker data manually as we work towards finding a better solution Thanks Mike Barone Michael Original Message From Kelly Katherine L Sent Friday February PM To Barone Michael Subject RE requested historical extract Who exactly is working on this and do we have any idea of how long it will take Original Message From Barone Michael Sent Friday February AM To Barone Michael Ruscitti Kevin Plachy Denver Lewis Andrew H Cuilla Martin Mckay Brad Mckay Jonathan Brawner Sandra F Parks Joe Denetsosie Troy Scott Susan M Bass Eric Considine Keith Bowler Tim Kelly Katherine L Subject RE requested historical extract Sorry that I sent the electronic quote data to everyone on this listI meant to sent it to our data group that is going to try to get the info into template Original Message From Barone Michael Sent Friday February AM To Ruscitti Kevin Plachy Denver Lewis Andrew H Cuilla Martin Mckay Brad Mckay Jonathan Brawner Sandra F Parks Joe Denetsosie Troy Scott Susan M Bass Eric Considine Keith Bowler Tim Kelly Katherine L Subject FW requested historical extract Here are the quotes Original Message From Considine Keith Sent Friday February AM To Bowler Tim Barone Michael Subject FW requested historical extract Heres the data from Truequote Original Message From Trevor Atkins mailto Sent Friday February AM To Considine Keith Subject requested historical extract Keith Please find attached the report that you requested I am leaving shortly for an offsite meeting but if you have any questions I will be in the office first thing Monday morning Best Trevor L Atkins Trevor L Atkins Project Manager True Quote LLC Work Direct mailto Trevor ruequotecom mailtoTrevor ruequotecom

RE Gas BrokersContacts Cc Thanks for the contacts Just to let you know were already working with Greg Kaufman from Fame a collaboration of Amerex and Prebon Theyre pulling together sample data for us to preview Amerex the day end quotes are limited in tenor usually only out to Oct Joe Parks already has copies of most of these reports Prebon same tenor problem as Amerex Dont know the status of the copies inhouse APB Truequote Im already working with Trevor Atkins We should get their data for free in the next couple of days Supposedly the Fame transactional data is better than the Amerex and Prebon end of day quotes The issue here will likely be data format more than content Ill let you know once we hear back Keith Original Message From McMichael Jr Ed Sent Wednesday February PM To Kelly Katherine L Bowler Tim Gronningsater Eric Wilson Shona Considine Keith Cc Miller Don Asset Mktg Subject FW Gas BrokersContacts Per your request please use the below sources Let me know how you make out Ed Original Message From Lavorato John Sent Wednesday February PM To McMichael Jr Ed Subject apbBeth Amerex Gilbert Natsource Ralph Prebon Donny
broker quotes Cc Rogers Id like to package the gas needs with the power needs for broker data Lets discuss on Tuesday where youre leaning for power Thanks KC

RE ERMS and GERMSSusan Do I need to do anything on this Original Message From Scott Susan M Sent Tuesday February AM To Bowler Tim Barone Michael Considine Keith Smith Mark Allan Gronningsater Eric Subject ERMS and GERMS Francis Lim Jeremy Wong Nilay Basu These individuals may now be with UBS but they should know who to contact on the estate side

Updated Curve Mark Status Cc PST RESCHEDULED FROM The estate has been requested to report on the current status going forward responsibility for marking of curves specifically regarding completeness timeliness and responsible personnel PwC has compiled a preliminary report based on their meetings with you andor your teams Please attend tomorrows meeting to confirm the preliminary report data and answer additional questions

Curve Validation MeetingPST All Our next validation meeting will be Thursday September th from am in EB No meeting will be held tomorrow given yesterdays demonstration meeting For the next meeting we will discuss the draft validation process and take any commentsquestions on the tools being developed Please review the process and presentation materials before the next meeting and feel free to forward any iterim commentsquestions to me as you have them Draft validation process Presentation materials from demonstration The demostration of tools that are being developed for curve selection and validation including curve grabber stale curve queries historical bands and others Regards KC

RE Ancillary Curves Cc Thanks Frank My only concern with setting these up before you get the answer from Research is that I dont think we can control from our end the posting of positions on these curves once they are set up I think we can get around reporting benchmark positions by inserting a zero conversion factor however if the curves are setup in the region index mapping and a position is loaded on said curve I assume VaR would be calcd I think this may already be happening calcing VaR with no positions with the existing ancillary curves that are already setup I ve asked Casey to take a look Original Message From Hayden Frank Sent Tuesday October PM To Considine Keith Cc Trevino Susan White Stacey W Postlethwaite John Subject RE Ancillary Curves Excellent question Currently I am working with Research to determine correct VAR methodology for ancillaries and as such we do not measure risk on these curves Even though this is the case we still require curves to be posted and maintained Thanks Frank Original Message From Considine Keith Sent Tuesday October PM To Hayden Frank Cc Trevino Susan White Stacey W Postlethwaite John Subject Ancillary Curves Frank The voicemail I left was regarding ancillary curves requested by John Burton may have emailed you on the request earlier Im following up bc hes out Question Do we have a rule regarding whether or not we calculated VaR and capture positions for ancillary business Based on discussions with Casey Evans we dont report ancillary activity for her regions var or positions In order to keep consistency across the business it seems that we would either report all ancillary or none Please advise Regards KC

FW Ancillary CurvesCasey I ran curve queries for the RIJN and RWZ ancillary curves we discussed the other day The queries showed that delta positions were captured for these ancillary curves which goes against what we discussed yesterday no VaR on ancillary positions I assume that since we have positions that there is a VaR unless theres another workaround outside of the query FYI I used the curve grabber tool in the rac website Please give me a call in the am to discuss Original Message From Hayden Frank Sent Tuesday October PM To Considine Keith Cc Trevino Susan White Stacey W Postlethwaite John Subject RE Ancillary Curves Excellent question Currently I am working with Research to determine correct VAR methodology for ancillaries and as such we do not measure risk on these curves Even though this is the case we still require curves to be posted and maintained Thanks Frank Original Message From Considine Keith Sent Tuesday October PM To Hayden Frank Cc Trevino Susan White Stacey W Postlethwaite John Subject Ancillary Curves Frank The voicemail I left was regarding ancillary curves requested by John Burton may have emailed you on the request earlier Im following up bc hes out Question Do we have a rule regarding whether or not we calculated VaR and capture positions for ancillary business Based on discussions with Casey Evans we dont report ancillary activity for her regions var or positions In order to keep consistency across the business it seems that we would either report all ancillary or none Please advise Regards KC

Ancillary Curves Cc Frank The voicemail I left was regarding ancillary curves requested by John Burton may have emailed you on the request earlier Im following up bc hes out Question Do we have a rule regarding whether or not we calculated VaR and capture positions for ancillary business Based on discussions with Casey Evans we dont report ancillary activity for her regions var or positions In order to keep consistency across the business it seems that we would either report all ancillary or none Please advise Regards KC

august curve validationsAny luck on finished the Aug curve vals Unless youve already put the a report together all we need to do for August is list the curves validated and whether or not there were any issues with the curves based on the work done I can do this Can you come up with the summary statement similar to last month Ill put the comment and list together with the rest of the BU Im putting the July report below for reference Are you planning on doing the September curves this Fridays the last day of the month

Curve Validation Report Repository Cc All The Curve Validation folderrepository has been setup on the O drive and includes the following folder structure bold names are those items with subfolders OCurve Validation Reporting Consolidated EES EGM Financial Enron Americas US Gas US Power Canada Gas Canada Power Enron Broadband Services Enron Global Assets Enron Global Markets excl Financial EGM Financial Enron Industrial Markets Procedures and Template the reporting template procedures and rollout document are included here Ive already requested access for you based on the validation team structure Exhibit A in the procedures mailed last week This request should hopefully be done by midweek Going forward if additional personnel in your groups need access to the folders please have them fill out an erequest The requests will come to me and I will call the RM personnel on each team to clear access rights Let me know if you have any questions Regards KC

FW power sitesStacey Not sure if you want to call Lloyd or not but in addition to Bloomberg Amerex and Truequote you can get viewing rights to EOL through erequest Ill keep looking and let you know if I get any others Original Message From Davenport Lacrecia Sent Friday September AM To Considine Keith Subject RE power sites Bloombergcom gives hourly quotes for the hourly market for curves If you need more information I suggest you talk to Lloyd Will He is the Director of the power fundamentals group Original Message From Considine Keith Sent Friday September AM To Davenport Lacrecia Subject power sites Lucretia I work in global risk and am looking for a listing of online quote sites for power I was hoping you may have some sites Xotchil thought you may Could you forward me the addresses of sites you use Thanks Keith
